text: But to understand how it works, we first need to start with its closest relative; The Number Line.

video: ./clip_video/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/clip_0023.mp4
text: A number line starts at zero, and represents positive numbers as you move to the right and negative numbers as you more to the left.

text_latent: ./clip_video_text/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/A_number_line_starts_at_zero,_and_represents_positive_numbers_as_you_move_to_the_right_and_negative_numbers_as_you_more_to_the_left.pt

video: ./clip_video/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/clip_0024.mp4
text: And there's usually marks showing where each integer is along the way.

text_latent: ./clip_video_text/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/And_there's_usually_marks_showing_where_each_integer_is_along_the_way.pt

text: Now imagine cloning that number line and rotating the copy counter-clockwise by 90 degrees so that the second number line is perpendicular to the first and they intersect at their zero points.

video: ./clip_video/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/clip_0026.mp4
text: What we have now is a "number plane". It's basically like a 2-Dimensional version of a number line, but that second dimension makes it much more useful.

video: ./clip_video/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/clip_0027.mp4
text: With a simple 1-Dimensional number line, we could show where various numbers were located along that line by drawing (or plotting) points.

text_latent: ./clip_video_text/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/With_a_simple_1-Dimensional_number_line,_we_could_show_where_various_numbers_were_located_along_that_line_by_drawing_(or_plotting)_points.pt

text: But no matter how many points we plot, they're always on the same line.

text_latent: ./clip_video_text/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/But_no_matter_how_many_points_we_plot,_they're_always_on_the_same_line.pt

text: But with a 2-Dimensional number plane, we can plot points anywhere in that 2D area, and that opens up a whole new world of possibilities.

text_latent: ./clip_video_text/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/But_with_a_2-Dimensional_number_plane,_we_can_plot_points_anywhere_in_that_2D_area,_and_that_opens_up_a_whole_new_world_of_possibilities.pt

text: And they're often called the "horizontal" and "vertical" axes because of that.

text: But even more often, the axes are referred to by variable-based names.

text_latent: ./clip_video_text/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/But_even_more_often,_the_axes_are_referred_to_by_variable-based_names.pt

text: The horizontal axis is called "the X-axis" and the vertical axis is called "the Y-Axis".
video_latent: ./clip_video/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/clip_0044.mp4.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video_text/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/The_horizontal_axis_is_called_"the_X-axis"_and_the_vertical_axis_is_called_"the_Y-Axis".pt

video: ./clip_video/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/clip_0045.mp4
text: Why use variable names?
video_latent: ./clip_video/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/clip_0045.mp4.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video_text/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/Why_use_variable_names?.pt

video: ./clip_video/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/clip_0046.mp4
text: Well there's two good reasons.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/clip_0046.mp4.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video_text/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/Well_there's_two_good_reasons.pt

video: ./clip_video/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/clip_0047.mp4
text: The first is that variable names are more flexible than horizontal and vertical, which relate to a specific orientation in space that may not always be relevant.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/clip_0047.mp4.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video_text/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/The_first_is_that_variable_names_are_more_flexible_than_horizontal_and_vertical,_which_relate_to_a_specific_orientation_in_space_that_may_not_always_be_relevant.pt

video: ./clip_video/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/clip_0048.mp4
text: And the second reason is that each of the two coordinate numbers is actually a variable that relates to a specific position along one of the two axes of the coordinate plane.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/clip_0048.mp4.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video_text/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/And_the_second_reason_is_that_each_of_the_two_coordinate_numbers_is_actually_a_variable_that_relates_to_a_specific_position_along_one_of_the_two_axes_of_the_coordinate_plane.pt

video: ./clip_video/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/clip_0049.mp4
text: And since those variables are usually called 'X' and 'Y', it makes sense to name the two axes the same way.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/clip_0049.mp4.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video_text/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/And_since_those_variables_are_usually_called_'X'_and_'Y',_it_makes_sense_to_name_the_two_axes_the_same_way.pt

video: ./clip_video/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/clip_0050.mp4
text: The first coordinate number listed will be called 'X' and the second coordinate number listed will be called 'Y'.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/clip_0050.mp4.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video_text/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/The_first_coordinate_number_listed_will_be_called_'X'_and_the_second_coordinate_number_listed_will_be_called_'Y'.pt

video: ./clip_video/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/clip_0051.mp4
text: And we're always going to list the numbers in that same order, 'X' first and then 'Y', so that we never get confused about which is which.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/clip_0051.mp4.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video_text/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/And_we're_always_going_to_list_the_numbers_in_that_same_order,_'X'_first_and_then_'Y',_so_that_we_never_get_confused_about_which_is_which.pt

video: ./clip_video/Algebra Basics： Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics [9Uc62CuQjc4]/videos/clip_0052.mp4
text: In fact, coordinates are often called "ordered pairs" because they're a pair of numbers that are always listed in the same order: 'X' value first... 'Y' value second.

text: So if you have the coordinates, (3, 5) that means X = 3 and Y = 5.

text: Quadrant 1 is the upper right quadrant, and it contains all of the points where both the X and Y values are positive.
